contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The guests drank wine from gold cups" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Drinks were served in golden cups

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when the king's officials told her about his command" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: at the word of the king that had been brought to her by the officials

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When they hear the king's decree" or "When they hear what you have commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When the king's decree is proclaimed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They wrote this decree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This decree was given

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Tell your servants to search" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let a search be made

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Let Hegai, the king's official, who is in charge of the women, take care of them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let them be put under the care of Hegai, the king's official, who is in charge of the women

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "After the king commanded that they search for some beautiful women" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When the king's order and decree were proclaimed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they brought many young women" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: many young women were brought

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Hegai, the overseer of the women, also began to take care of Esther when they brought her to the king's palace" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Esther also was taken into the king's palace and put under the care of Hegai, the overseer of the women

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "she could take whatever she desired" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: whatever she desired was given to her

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When Mordecai learned about what they were planning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When the matter was revealed to Mordecai

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The king investigated and confirmed the report, and ordered his servants to hang both men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The report was investigated and confirmed, and both the men were hanged

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the king summoned his scribes ... they wrote a decree containing all that Haman had commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the king's scribes were summoned ... a decree containing all that Haman had commanded was written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They wrote the decree in the name of King Ahasuerus and Haman sealed it with the king's signet ring" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It was written in the name of King Ahasuerus and was sealed with his ring

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The officials in every province made a copy of the letter become the law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A copy of the letter was made law in every province

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They told all the people in every province" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: In every province it was made known to all the people

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They also distributed the decree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The decree was also distributed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "one of the officials whom the king had assigned to serve her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: one of the king's officials who had been assigned to serve her

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If you ask for up to half of my kingdom, I will give it to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Up to half of my kingdom, it will be given to you

contextId.information: This can be expressed in active form. AT: "What did I do to give honor" or "What did we do to give honor " (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: What was done to give honor

contextId.information: This can be expressed in active form. However it may be good to find a way that does not give the impression that servants were accusing the king. AT: "No one did anything for Mordecai" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Nothing was done for him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "let someone bring royal robes" or "tell your servants to bring royal robes"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: let royal robes be brought

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Then let them give the robes and the horse" or "Then tell them to give the robes and the horse" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then let the robes and the horse be given

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If you ask for up to half of my kingdom, I will give it to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Up to half of the kingdom, and it will be granted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. The abstract noun "disaster" can be expressed with the more concrete verbs "destroy" or "kill." AT: "the king was deciding to cause a disaster against him" or "the king was deciding to destroy him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: disaster was being decided against him by the king

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "where servants had served the wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: where the wine had been served
